text: Color marrón, turbio, con capa de espuma de un blanco amarronado de cuatro o cinco dedos de grosor (grumosa, burbujas amplias, parece que no va a durar pero se mantiene durante largo rato). Excesivamente carbonatada, para mi gusto. En cuanto toca tu lengua parece que el líquido se convierte en burbujas y la experiencia de saborear no es tan placentera como podría haber sido. Aroma a pomelo, melocotón, piña, malta caramelizada (muy por debajo de lo demás). Sabor a melocotón, piña, cítricos, con base de malta caramelizada y tostada y reminiscencias a frutos secos y cacao. Final de amargor ligero. Postgusto casi inexistente, ligeramente tostado. Más IPA que Brown Ale. Cruce interesante pero a años luz de lo esperado (como concepto, bien; su realización... no tanto). Disfrutable pero no merece un top 50. Por alguna extraña razón si uno añade el último tercio de la botella (repleto de sedimento) todo se vuelve aún más turbio (estilo lodazal) y gran parte de esa carbonatación se pierde. Más fácil de beber pero sabor más rancio. No sé, no me convence del todo esta cerveza.

Copenhagen 24/5 2017. 50 cl on tap from Gaarden & Gaden. Pours slightly hazy copper brown with creamy off-white head, Settles as 1 cm thick layer of dense foam. Massive lacing. Aroma is quite citric and bitter with a solid whiff of exotic fruit. A little caramel just to remind me that this is a brown ale. Medium carbonation and medium thick palate. Flavor is lightly sweet followed by heavy bitterness. An orgy of grape fruit. Aftertaste is bitter with a solid dry finish. Not the typical brown ale - but a brutal citra bitter version of the Classic.
Aroma y sabor de pino, resinas, cítrico. Fondo maltoso y amargor resinoso largo e intenso.
Tap @ Cafe Langebro. Dark brown, big beige head. Nutty grain aroma, Nutty chocolate flavour. Bitter oaty aftertaste. I am not normally a brown ale fan but this is a really good one.
Tap.Dark brown colour with medium head.Aroma of caramel and brown cake nice well balanced with nuts flavor and hops,smooth and well done creamy and smooth finish.

Tap (Copenhagen, Helsinki)
Nice tangerine aroma, as it warms more mango. Deep orange, small tight head. Fizzy palate, harsh. Pleasant citrussy grapefruit taste, but lacking depth after the initial zesty bite. Tons of swirling, and it was still too fizzy.

Draught at Ølhus København. Dark amber color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, floral hops, nuts, caramel, mango and grass. Bitter finish with citrus, floral hops, nuts, caramel and mango. Very nice brew, interesting brown ale / IPA mix.
Bottle shared. Pours a clear nut brown color with 2 fingers of foam that linger. Toasted caramel, very malt forward. Light body. Good carbonation. Cocoa powder and lactose. Decent brown.

From tap at Fermentoren Aarhus. Pours a hazy reddish brown with a creamy, off white head. Aroma has nice caramel and slight roasty malts, lots of fruity hops, sweet orange, together they are like caramelized orange zest. Taste is toasty malty, some sweetness, rather high bitterness. Average carbonation and a relatively light body.
Tap @ Mikkeller, Aarhus. Light hazy bronze pour with a decent off white head. Notes of dank hops, resinous, some light toffee, caramel and some rye bread.
Pour Brown with a fine White head. Grape pine and light malty aromas. Medium bitter with sweet notes. Medium bodied light bitter finish
Sample from draft at fermentoren. Hazy Amber colour with a white head. Nose of biscuits malts, caramel, citrus, hoppy, Dried peaches, light spices.

Tap. Pours hazy orange/brown with a medium offwhite head. Aromas of dank hops, sweet malts, citrus, peach, caramel. Taste is bitter, peachy, malty, light roasty, earthy, subtle soapiness, bitter citrus. Pretty nice.
Dark brown pour with beige head. Toasty and roasted malty aroma and taste, medium sweet with some caramel, toffee, great hoppy backing, medium bitter in the finish

HOT!!!! Atemberaubender holzig erdiger Hopfenduft voller Zitrusaromen und dann im Mund wie einen Planierwalze. Mächtig, malzig, hopfenaromatisch und verwegen kantig, aber dann auch wieder angepasst rund. Ein Erlebnis!!! 25cl/4,50 vom Fass beim 2ten Bremer Bierfest.

On tap at Dansken, Göteborg. Hazy murky brown with off white head. Floral and fruity with light caramel and fresch citrusy hops. Semi dry with medium bitterness and medium carbonation. Wow, a brown ale that is not disgusting!

Flaska från Beergium. Gravöl med kusin Mattias. Mörkorange, bärnstensfärgad med fingerhögt gräddbeiget skum. Doft av frisk citra mot bakgrund av malttung kropp med apelsinskal, kåda och granskott. How : tap Appearance : almost clear light brown with a small off-white head. Aroma : tropical fruits, apples, caramel, grass, floral, herbs and citrus peel. Palate : medium body, average to light carbonation.

Toasty and roasted malty aroma and taste, medium sweet with some caramel, toffee, great hoppy backing, medium bitter in the finish. Lovely.
Bottle. Amber with red color, white foam. Aroma: sweet nectar, malt, tropical fruit, honey. Taste: sweet, malt, hops and fruit.
Bottle. dark brown with cream head from draft. Nose is citra hops. Nice roasted mlaty mocha body with hopiness as well.grerat

Bottle. Malty aroma of rye-bread/beer-bread???(øllebrød), roasted, caramel and. In mouth hoppy aroma of citrus, grapefruit and bitter orange-peel also comes thru. The flavours starts sweet but finish very bitter with long duration. The body is medium and the texture is creamy. Soft carbonation.
Коричне& на дне немного мутнова& Приятны& освежаю& вкус с нотками фруктов. В послевк& - горечь.

500 ml, flaske, 7,0 % ABV, BB: 10/2017, købt gennem Boxbeers, 13. juli 2015.
Aroma af Citra humle og lidt ristet malt. Senere fremkommer lidt noter af frugt. 
Rødbrun og rolig ufiltreret Brown Ale med 1 cm moccafarvet skumtop med ganske store bobler, som svinder til et tæt skum. 
Ganske dejlig øl med langt mere bitter smag end i en almindelig Brown Ale. Så fans af almindelig BA: keep away! I smagsbilledet er en vis let sødlig frugtagtig smag, men i stormål tillige en solid bitterhed. Balancen imellem smagselementerne er fin og fungerer. 
Opsummering: let sødme, middel til solid bitterhed. 
Mellem fyldig krop med en karbonering på veltilpasset niveau, som jeg vil vurdere til et nyk under medium. Konsistensen er klæbrig. Eftersmagen er lækker bittersød og medium lang. 
En øl, der OGSÅ udvikler sig efter åbning og temperering og bare bliver bedre og bedre. Fra "ganske dejlig øl" til "meget velsmagende".

Deep brown pour with a thin foamy light khaki head. Nutty earthy cocoa aromas mix with burnt caramel, and some kind of american/west coast hop bitterness underneath. The flavor is a wild ride full of unexpected twists. Theres this almost sour ale oak-iness right at the start, then the earthy English nuttiness comes in with a dash of earthy chocolate, a sharp herbal/orange rind hoppy bitter twang, with a lasting sort of citric bitterness mixed with a semisweet earthy cocoa nuttiness...Its fine, but India Brown Ales are my least favorite hybrid style so my judgement is skewed. Its a fine beer if youre into it. Well made too. Just would have been better without the hops.

Bottle during weekend of CBC15. Cloudy brown with beige head. Aroma is caramel, bread and citrus hops. Taste has caramel, sugar, bready malt, light roasty notes and lemon/grapefruit hops with some woody notes.

Flaska stallyktan örebro. Bärnstensfärgad smått grumlig vätska med ljusbrunt skum. Maltig doft med inslag av citrus och apelsin. Något trött och övervägande maltig smak med blött oblekt papper och hint av citrus

Yum, another great beer from Beer Here! I was a bit sceptic towards it being a brown ale, which is not my favorite, but the fruity flavors from the hops do really go smoothly together with the malty flavors of rye etc. Aroma of rye bread and abricot (which I read on the bottle but it is really there). Really original and yummie flavor!
Bottle @ home. Aroma of citrus, malt. Clear brown with off-white small head. Mostly lasting. Moderate bitterness, more citrus, light+ sweetness. full body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter finish.
@ Bishop Maria på fat. Humle, karamell i aromen, hel del maltighet och med fin fyllighet i kroppen.

Good bitter and fruity aroma. The taste is fruity, caramel, bitter and perhaps a little sweet. Lovely bitterness in the aftertaste that fills the mouth forever. Difficult to assess, but it was good nonetheless. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Fruity brown IPA with amazing appearance and body, but a somewhat tempered nose. There could definitely be more going on here in a bottle of certain freshness, I cannot say for sure how old this bottle is but its probably close to a year old. The flavors are still quite solid though, I definitely get a melon/cantaloupe quality amidst the sort of general "brownness" of the malts.  A little too bitter in the finish.
On tap at Archive Beer Boutique 080613. Had this one as Harvest IPA. Nice floral hop aromas and a long almost sticky hop finish.

On tap at Avenue Pub. Pours a cloudy brown with medium beige head that lasts. The aroma is caramel and bready malt. Medium mouthfeel with a sweet raisin and brown sugar. Easy to drink, good brown ale.
Pours deep brown. Citrus, malty, caramel, and bready malts. Flavor or is rich breads, malts, caramels, and citrus. Medium full body and medium sweet. Pretty good but a strange .

Appearance: Deep amber color with a tan head that stays in the glass a long time. Nice lacing.Aroma: Fruity, grapefruit hoppy and malty.Palate: Full body. Tad sweet and a fine bitterness. Average carbonation.Taste: Malty, chocolate, grapefruit hoppy and fruity. Very well hidden alcohol.Overall impression: Lovely and tasty ale.Personal stats: Bottle from Systembolaget in Uddevalla, Sweden.

In short: A somewhat fruity-hoppy dark roasted beer of some kind. Decent.
How: Bottle 500ml, consumed a few weeks after purchase after its long boat ride to North-America.
The look: Muddy brown body topped by a persistent small tan head.
In long: Nose is rich dark malts and moderately hoppy blending tropical fruits and nutty brownies. In mouth the beer feels rich, a creamy texture, a generous carbonation. Taste is creamy fudge, chocolaty and nutty, a certain roasted wood sensation, somewhat hoppy adding refreshing fruity flavors. More roasted than the average Brown Ale. Dry finish. A fun no-style bastard beer. Seems like Beer Here has two (or more) hoppy brown ales in their lineup, this Kama Citra was good but I much preferred their other hoppy brown ale Autumnic Fallout. Before craftbeer I used to exercise to make me feel good, but now I drink craftbeer and it makes me feel good AND funny AND intelligent AND sexy.

(500ml bottle) Pours a black body with a small tan head. Aroma of raisins, dates, chocolate, coriander, caramel, and toffee. Flavor of chocolate, roasted malt, grapefruit, caramel, grass, florals, raisins, and coriander.

Thanks to Blake for bringing the bottle. Poured medium-deep brown with a toasted marshmallow head. The aroma picked up sweet toasted coffee, nutty notes, and molasses with light citrus/piney hoppage around. The flavor found mostly nutty notes and molasses with bitter grapefruit and grassy bitterness around.. finished dry and toasty, with quite a bit of residual bitterness. Medium-bodied with low-moderate carbonation.. wouldnt liked a little more bitterness, but it was aiight.
Pours to a deep brown mahogany body with a creamy tan head. The beer is a hoppy grapefruit and deep toasty caramelized malts. Very much a brown ale with lots of citra hops. Medium full body. Robust.

Grifo. Vaso Shaker. Color cobre oscuro con tintes rubi a contraluz. Corona beige, cremosa, que presenta bastante buena retención. Aromas tostados y herbales mezclado con matices muy sutiles de chocolate. Maltas tostadas y fresco amargor al primer sorbo redondeado por notas de chocolate. Cuerpo medio y carbonatación moderada. Textura oleosa. Final amargo y seco. Toque dulce/amargo de cacao en el retrogusto. ABV bien enmascarado en una cerveza bien equilibrada y nada plana.
On-tap. Shaker glass. Dark copper color, ruby to the light. Beige & creamy crown shows fairly good retention. Toasted & floral aromas mixed with very subtle chocolate hues. Toasted malts & crispy bitterness at first sip rounded by chocolate notes. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Oily texture. Dry bitter finish. Sweet/bitter cocoa on the aftertaste. ABV well hidden in a well balanced, no flat beer.

Bottle. 
Soapy, big bubles, khaki head. Deep dark chocolate body.
Nutty, light caramel, lightly roasted, honey sweet, really clean h2o. Hint of DMS. Impressed by clarity of aromas.
Hops oils dominant, not resiny or bitter. Slight roasted toffee, with a big oily burst of citrusy (lime) hops. Hint of metallic lingers. Rich butterscotch, maple syrup lingers.
As I drink more beers from Denmark the more impressed I am with h2o composition; very clean, pronounced flavors. Distinct, flavorful, well put together. A true brown ale with an upgraded hop profile. 
Reminiscent to Anchors Brekles Brown, but Kama Citra has more rich flavors.

Pours dark brown with good head formation and retention. Aroma is an interesting blend of peach and melon from the hops mixed with roast, caramel and toffee from the malt. Flavors of toffee, caramel, and coffee with a background of melon. Medium / light body, perfectly carbonated that finishes dry with a lingering of toffee, mineral water, and ashy roast. A very interesting and well made beer but the combination of toffee / roast and melon flavors is a bit strange. They seem to fight each other as apposed to meld.

500 ml courtesy of sloth- thanks again, Bert! Pours a coffee brown color with a finger of beige head that settles unevenly. Aroma has a good dose of hops, with an earthy, piney, orange citrus character, along with toast and dark chocolate. Flavor of toasted and chocolate malts, candied nuts, and citrus. Medium-bodied, with a smooth, malty, bitter mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. Good, complex, hoppy brown ale.

Pours a brown color with a small head and nice lacing on the glass.

The aroma is nutty with chocolate & a nice bright hoppiness, plenty of citrus, & some bug repellant. 

The flavor has a nice bit of chocolate, some good bitterness, & some light toffee. The hop character is bright with a nice bitterness, this does the grape-y citra thing about as well as any beer Ive tried. The malt toastiness is really pleasant and well integrated into a hoppy beer here.
Fruity stuff! Little white head, aroma of chocolate, malts and fruits. Taste is chocolate, aplle and citric fruits. Easy to drink.
Bottle. Dark amber beer with a small beige head. Hoppy and nice malty aroma. Hoppy, malty flavour with some dill and mushrom notes.
Bottle from The Trappist. Pours dark brown with a modest tan head and a chocolate and treacle aroma. There is a full-bodied brown flavor with a slightly hoppy finish.
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours dark brown/black with off white head. Taste is roasted malts with a huge citrus hop finish

Clear brown, small thight head. Aroma of coffee and green aplle - pear. Ok body with clean, balanced mouth. More pear and some resin hop. Nice bitter finish. Almost like "Black  IPA" in style. Not your everyday Brown ale :)

Expected an IPA due to its name, was surprised when a dark brown ale was given to me. Light tan head. Hop and citrus nose. Malt, raisin, hop, citrus aroma. Good body and carbonation, well balanced. Sweet and bitter, light bitter ending. Good.
Pours dark brown with cream head from draft. Nose is citra hops. Nice roasted mlaty mocha body with hopiness as well. Really good

Tap. Pours dark, tawny brown with thin, creamy beige head; short retention and spare lacing. Aroma is toast and cookie malts, light toffee, prunes, raisins, floral hops, and light spice. Flavor is dry, roast malts forward with supporting dark fruit esters, woody notes, earthy hops, and light toffee; dry, lightly bitter finish. Medium body and low carbonation.

Tap @ Maxs. Pours clear dark brown with a medium, frothy tan head, short retention with good lacing. Aroma is caramel and chocolate malt, dates and figs with earthy hops. Flavor is malt and hop balanced with dark fruits and a dry finish. Full body and medium carbonation.

Was totally expecting something different given the beers name.  Thought that Id pour a 24 karat elixir with bright pungent citrus bursting from the glass.  Instead I got a chestnut body with a mahogany core and a latte colored head.  Mocha, cocoa, roasted coffee, and resinous piney hops are all present.  Distinct.  Interesting.  Not a bad brown!

On tap at Schouskjelleren. Reddish brown body. Small tan head with good lacing. Aroma of chocolate, coffee and bread. The best brown ale I?ve tasted so far, although it?s almost like a stout. Feels excellent in the mouth, but the alcohol taste becomes dominating. Very balanced and good.

Bottle, shared with Parksy. Dark copper with a golden crown. Hoppy aroma with sweet caramel. Burnt sugars within malty sweetness with a decent load of fruity hop character, pineapple and grapefruit notes. Surprisingly malty -- didnt expect this to be a brown ale, let alone a good one!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle from State Line. Pours dark brown with tan mocha head. Nose and taste of citrus, grapefruit rind, toasted brown malt, cocoa, coffee, toasted grain and roast. Medium body. Mildly bitter finish.

Bottle, thanks to larsniclas. Clear amber beer with a nice beige head. Roasted chocolate aroma, cocoa powder, vinous notes, licorice, some raisins, bitter hop notes. Roasted chocolate flavor, bitter hops, caramel, metallic notes.
Draft. Dark brown beer with a big dark cream head. Dark malt aroma. Citrus and light cocoa flavor with caramel. Medium bodied. Caramel and light cocoa lingers with citrus.

Draft at Paradiso Dupont. Dark brown pour with small bubbly tan head. Nose and flavor marked with caramel, roasted coffee,  piney hop, citrus, mango and pineapple. Smooth and medium to high attenuation. Very good.

Aroma is grapefruit, citrus/orange and sweetish malts.  The flavor is grapefruit (along with a pulpy texture), citrus/kiwi/tropical fruit, mild candy sweetness, malts and a tangy and slightly sour finish.
Brown in color... Aroma of citrus and oak...  Flavor is citrus with roasted notes and malts on the palate... Interesting beer

On tap at Pangaea Shelton Bros night, a hoppy brown is better than a brown. I like; falls slightly short.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This was a superb tasty beverage. Really really smooth and silky with the taste and flavour of toasty rich malts used.  The hops add some spice to the beer but never took away from the beers over all smooth feel but complemented the malts in a very pleasant way.

Pours dark brown with a 2 finger, creamy tan head. Very hoppy aroma, lots of citrus and tropical fruit, some pine right away, leading to roasted nuts, chocolate, coffee and light roast. Flavor starts of with chocolate, sweet cereal, roasted nuts, herbal hops, sweet, crusty white bread and floral notes, finishes with dark caramel, earth, burnt toffee, roast and leathery tannins. Palate is syrupy on entry, much more dry, but oily from there on out, with a moderate strength, but definitely sharp and blanketing carbonation. The after effects are pretty astringent. Good stuff overall, more of a Black IPA than most IPAs, but it just doesnt fit together as well as it could. The mouthfeel could us some work as well.

Tap at Ma Che, Roma, 09/02/13.
Hazed dark mahogony brown with a decent sized light tan head.
Nose is dark malts, hops, light pine notes, toffee, touch of spice.
Taste comprises caramel, brown sugars, toffee, hops, pine.
Medium body, moderate carbonation, light bitterness in the dry finish.
A decent hoppy brown number.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Dark black/brown pour. Fluffy tan head. Smell is of roasted malt, cocoa, and slight pine. Flavor is chocolatey, slight metallic, citrus, caramel. Decent hoppy brown.

On tap. Intense black colour with a flat head on top. Creamy with a medium carbonation it has a fresh taste with citrus and cocoa taste. Refreshing and easy to drink enough. The alcohol is not so noticeable at the beginning. Great beer.

On tap at the Trappist. It pours brown with a beige head. the aroma is toasty with hints of cocoa and caramel. Strong tropical fruity hops like pineapple and orange. The flavor is mostly malty toast, cocoa, hop bitterness in the finish with hints of ashy roast at the end. Hints of pineapple and orange throughout.

On tap at Henrik. The colour is deep hazy brown with a small light beige head. Aroma of nuts, chocolate truffles, fruity hops and some bubble gum. Lots of fruityness in the flavour as well with apricot, sweet malt, some coffee and wood. Soft and slick mouthfeel, and a light bitterness. A well-balanced ale with a nice hoppy touch.

Bottle from Nugget Market in Davis, CA. Pours dark brown with a foamy/creamy tan head. Aroma is citrus/pine, or perhaps cat pee. Med body. Flavor is citrus/pine with lots and lots of hoppiness. Theres some background roasted/nutty malt, but its background. A little chocolate pops forth, and theres definitely some grapefruit rind. All in all this finishes hoppy, bitter and delicious.

On tap at the Alehouse Project, for the hop festival. Great, malty, with subtle hoppiness. Aromas of chocolate, caramel, with hints of liquorice. Taste is malty, with bitter notes, and long length. Palate is creamy, and full bodied. Black, with a big frothy head.

Pours a medium brownish orange with a frothy two finger eggshell head. On the nose its earthy caramel malts and juicy citrus notes. The palate is ncie and balanced with rich malty caramel notes playing well with the hoppy fruit driven flavors of the citra. Nice clean bitterness on the finish cleans up the backend maltiness nicely.

Poured into a snifter while listening to a lecture on hops by John Palmer. Aroma is of grapefruit hops as the citra is known for. Did not expect this to pour dark until I saw it was a brown. Flavour is amazing!! Chocolate and citrus is really nice. The palate is very smooth, there has to be oats in this!? Not overly bitter like I imagined. More bitterness comes from the malt than the hops. Tastes One dimensional as some single hop beers do. Overall a really good beer!

This beer is very special. Its much more than just a hopped up porter which is a quick and dirty way to describe it. The Citra hops are gentle enough to not overpower the malt and the result is a beautiful marriage of delicate bitterness, intense citrus, balanced by coffee and caramel. The finish lasts forever and makes you feel like you just had dessert and coffee.

Dark brown/black,slight red hue.Creamy frothy white head/lacing.
 Aroma is a citrus fresh fruit.Not the sharp citrus but a sweet light fruit like melon.Fairly hoppy nose.
 Taste is a hoppy carmel,mild chocolate,more hops,some sweetness, a little bit of wateryness almost.Pretty hoppy,a fairly sweet brown ale.Has some yeastiness. Kinda like it/kinda dont.More kinda like it though.

8th April 2011Clear deep red brown beer, good pale tan head. Sweetish coffee nose! Smooth palate, slightly dry. Even malt with some dark character. Bitter citric and pine hops. The overall impression however is of a beer that is coffee and bitter toffee! Light and fairly bitter finish. Interesting!

On tap at Cardinal, Stavanger. Pours very dark brown with a small tanned head. Aroma is fruity, pine needles, light roasted. Smooth mouthfeel, light roasted bitter,some coffee, dry and roasted lingering finish. Good one.
Fra fat på Cardinaltreff des-12: en uvanlig kombinasjon, brown ale med syrlig amerikansk humle. Synes ikke det fungerer, opplever den som tynn og med en smak av bitter sjokolade.

Bottle. Clear dark brown with small light brown head. Aroma has notes of caramel and tropical fruits. Taste is caramel, yeast, bread, melon, cocoa powder. Ends hoppy and bitter. Lots of stuff to pick up in the taste. Interesting take on a brown ale.

Pours amber with a fading head.
Nose shows lots of sweet malt and tropical fruit confectionery. Very sweet smelling. Some resinous notes too.
The sweetness follows as a flavour, both in the copious crystal malt notes and as tropical fruit characters. Some pine shows too, followed by a bitterness that plays second fiddle to the malt.
Body feels a bit thick, while the carbonation could be higher to cut through the sweetness.
A very drinkable IPA.

[Høst Citra] Bottle (50cl). Inch-thick light beige head, sticky, creating foam shapes and leaving a solid band of lacing. Very dark brown colour. Aroma of malt, hops, herbs, caramel, brandy, grapefruit. Medium body, soft carbonation. Semi-sweet taste upfront (dried fruits), gradually becoming more bitter, leading to a dry and herbal finish.

Draught. Dark brown colour with a foamy tan head. Aroma has lots of pine needles, citrus, grapefruit, chocolate and caramel malts. Taste is bitter with the caramel malts more pronounced than in the aroma. Medium body with an average to lively carbonation: Finishes long lasting bitter with roasted malts, and hints of coffee and chocolate. A very nice hopped-up brown ale.

Draught at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Poured amber in color with a whitish head. Tropical fruits and some caramel malts in aroma, sweet and hoppy. Citrus and bitter hops in flavor mostly. Roasted malts and even some coffee also.

500ml bottle from Bierkompass

Nice bottle design :-) Pours dark brown with high creamy head. Smells very malty-roasty, adorable smell of citra hops. Starts with lots of citra hops, perfect balanced with the roasted malts and some chocolate and caramell. Finish is long-lasting with lots of citra hops and chocolatey and caramelly malts!
Bottle. Aroma of caramel, coffee, hops and malt. Dark brown colour with beige head.. Very much black coffee in flavour with a hint of liqurice and a pleasant dry hopsfnish.

Dark, almost black, has an off-white head, medium duration. Aroma of dark roasted malts, espresso coffee, odd light chocolate. Flavor starts medium sweet, then some more espresso, finish moderate bitter. Creamy, dry texture.
chocolate, coffee, brown foam, black, light sweetness, lightly bitter, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, bitter, long finish,
50 cl bottle @ home. Pours brown (basically the colour of cola) with pretty much no head at all. Aroma is toasted malt, nuts, and some hops. Flavour is hoppy with some malty sweetness as well.

Bottle shared at a cottage near Blokhus, summer 2012. Bought at Vinspecialisten Aalborg
Brown, small big bubbled head. Smells of citrus, zests and some malts. Medium sweet, alot of citrus. Medium bitter, resins and zests. Nice citra beer, works quite well with citra in a brown ale

650 mL bottle.  I think I got this one in a trade with Plovmand.  Rusty brown with a small, persistant, beige head.  It smells like a hoppy brown; it even has that kinda thin, tinny smell that a lot of Brit browns have.   There  are similarities to an American Amber as well, with the caramel and the hops amd such.  The flavour is hoppier than expected, and mot as sweet.  The caramel becomes more bitter chocolate, although the sweetmess does not disappear entirely.  Really nice beer.

On tap at Schouskjelleren, april 2012.
Dark brown color, with a big tanned head. 
Aroma is no surprise dominated by the citra hop, with a malty base. Taste of citrus, pine, chocolate, straw and dark malts, a very very good beer. High bitterness too, this beer must surely be pushing the limits for a brown ale, without going too far

Bottle from omhper, thanks.
Fluffy beige head. Red-Amber clear color.
Hard roasted malt together with piny hops that goes into a grassy hoppiness. Much complex taste with sweet caramell and black roasted malt taste and some citrus hop taste.
Gedronken bij dutchdrebus en benzai. Licht bruine schuimkraag, kastanje bruin van kleur. Ruikt hoppig, ipa achtig. Smaakt naar stout, koffie, mokka, hoppig, zoet en bitter.

50cl bottle shared by Dutchdrebus. Slightly unclear dark red color, medium sized beige to light brown head that lasts for quite awhile and leaves a nice lacing. Smell malts, hops, hay, slightly bread and dough. Taste malts, some caramel, hints of coffee, lightly moccha, hint of dark chocolate and hops again. Way more to find in the taste than I expected! Very nice combination! A bit thin texture, medium to full carbo, medium body.

Bottle @ home. Ruby red to brown colour with a decent beige head. Smells very hoppy, very bitter, very fruity, very lovely, some malts, caramel and sweet. Tastes very hoppy, bitter and grapefruits, mixed with a pleasant and soft brown ale taste and some coffee notes. Great blend of styles. Great carbo, medium body.

Bottle......It pours hazy dark brown with a very small light beige head..... The aroma is fruity, hops, melon and grape..... The flavor bitter sweet, some grapefruit with a peachy, melon, bitter finish.... nice....
Väldigt trevlig. Smak och doft av torkad frukt, humle, choklad, farinsocker och med en tydlig beska med grapetoner.
Dark brown beer. The head is ok, but dissapears a bit quick. Caramel, citrussy beer. A good long holding dry bitter aftertaste.

350ml, tap at Gaasa. Coal dark-brown body, transparent. Beige head blanketing the glass. Caramel malts to the nose. Comprehensive malt-fruity taste of mid-sweet chocolate malts, dried fruits and dark grapefruits. Bittersweet tail. Fine bodied. Enjoyed outside in warm sunny weather (Oslo, 24.05.2012).

On tap at Gaasa, Oslo. Brown with a small, light brown head. Light hoppy aroma with malt, caramel, fruit, citrus and notes of lightly roasted malt. Malty and hoppy with a nice bitterness. Medium body. Quite pleasant and easy to drink. More bitterness in the finish than expected.  (2012-05-26)
Bottle. Creamy off-white good mostly lasting head. Dark amber colour. Heavy malty and moderate hoppy aroma

500 ml bottle. Finland.
Very dark brown colour with tiny tan head.
Citrusy fruity sweetish hoppy aroma. Flavour is also sweetish fruity citrusy hoppy, some bitterness and lots of liquorice dryness. Bitterness in aftertaste. Quite OK but not worth the 14 euros (I paid).

Possibly the weirdest beer Ive ever had.

Appearance is dark brown. Smells fruity, chocolate, coffee and fruit. Tastes of chocolate, coffee, brown sugar and fruit. Theres also a really bizzare sensation as it goes down.

I like this beer but I dont understand it.

(Draught at Pikkulintu, 20120424) The beer poured dark brown and a bit hazy. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had malts, caramell and fruitiness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were molasses, caramell, citricness, fruitiness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy, fruity and bitter. An interesting very fruity brown ale. A bit confusing beer but a tasty one, too.

On tap at Schous
Dark brown color, good foam
Well integrated hoppy aromas
Medium body & medium/high complexity
Very enjoyable, more hops then usal for genre

Dark amber colour. Hazy. Caramelly nose with tropical fruits aromas. Hoppy. Grapefruit and peaches. Medium-bodied. Complex malty flavours. Quite nice.

Bottle. Low fluffy lasting white head. Very dark brown body. Sweet hard roasted barley malt coffee bread caramel aroma. Sweet light bitter coffee caramel roasted malt flavor. High carbonation. Long aftertaste.

50 cl bottle @ Timo A.
Rated on 20110627. 
Pours clear red color with minimal head. Aroma of distinct citra hops, fruits and something stuffy that I cant quite make of. Flavor of stuffy fruits, roasted malts, dried berries and spices. The back label is quite interesting.
5425

As Beer Here Høst CitraDark brown color, with a giant compact head. The citrusy hop aroma is very nice, penetrating, with some roasted malt and metallic tones. Very good mild chocolate flavor, supporting a correct body and smooth mouthfeel; with strong hopping, very resiny; there is some moderate residual sweetness; some more roasted malts in the end.A Brown IPA, powerful and balanced; excellent.

Tap (squealer). Clear copper with a creamy pale beige head. Aroma of pink grapefruit, caramel and nectarines. Taste is bitter upfront with lots of citrus. Its nice but a far too much for balance. Underneath theres bitter chocolate and coffee. A little salty at the end. The soft-spoken charms of brown ale are comprehensively obliterated here.

(Draught at Bishops Arms Folkungagatan, Stockholm) Dark brown colour, almost black, with frothy beige head. Roasted, hoppy nose with notes of pine needles, chocolate and dark rye bread. Malty, roasted taste with coffee, dark chocolate, hints of ashes, pine needles, citrus and lots of fresh hops in a finish with a solid bitterness. Medium body, quite dry. Goes down as a black IPA in my book, but whatever it is, its a very fine and tasty beer.

14/II/2012 50cl bottle from De Hopduvel (Gent) @ Klaas place - BB 8/II/13 (2012-128) Thanks to Klaas for sharing the bottle!
Clear brown beer, small irregular beige head with big bubbles. Aroma: very fruity, pineapple, biscuit, little sweet malty, caramel. MF: low carbon, full body. Taste: very bitter start, mocha, tobacco, bit fruity (pineapple and citrus). Aftertaste: coffee, hop bitterness, citric sour. Had greater expectations of this.
Hazy orange with a medium white head. Malty with fruity notes. Malt, caramel, fruit and bitterness. Medium body with a nice bitter finish.

Bottled bought at de Molen. Slight hazy brown color, short lasting brownish head. Lovely aroma of citra hops, which pairs nelson sauvin like aroma with a fair amount of citrus. In the back some chocolat , biscuit and caramel notes are present . Awesome aroma. Quite bitter taste, very fruity, but again chocolat and caramel sweetness to balance it up. Simply stunning brew. D-licious!

Im a bit confused by this beer. Looks like a brown ale but theres a massive amount of lifted, floral, citrus infused hop action dominating the nose. It only lets up a touch in the palate but the intent of the intent of the beer is clear. Very hoppy but never aggressive.
Medium dark brown ale with a hoppy, fruity and fresh bitterness with a nice sting to it. Id have one more anytime :-)

Draught at Tre Små Rum.
Clear redbrown with an off-white head. Aroma light to medium malty (caramel, nut), heavy hoppy (tropical fruit). Flavor light to medium sweet, almost heavy bitter. Light to medium body.

Toffee colored pour. Khaki colored head. Slow to die and leaves lacing. Seems the head keeps building as it sits. Huge citrusy aroma mixed with malt. Slight roasted undertone. Bready taste with citrus and pine. Dry finish. Thin body. Pretty good.

From bottle. Pours dark brown with decent off white head. Aroma of coffee and distinctive citra hops. Taste also has lots of coffee, some chocolate and citra hops. A very interesting and intriguing beer. Excellent

Jädrans trevlig brown ale med finfin Citra humle som huvudaktör. Toner av pomelo, kaffe och tallbarr. Medium men ändå en ganska bestämd - här är jag kropp. Lång lätt syrlig efterbeska. Allt som allt...en mycket god översakande öl.

2011-11-24
Beautiful ruby red colour. Delightfully full-bodied aroma, well balanced with (sweet) cocoa malt, a fresh hopiness and a light flowery touch. Taste bites! Really IPA-like bitterness with some cocoa and coffee. Unfortunately the bitterness is off balance, which also goes for the aftertaste. This beer starts off really good but then run into the ditch.

Tasted November 17. 2011: Host Citra alias Kama Citra. Singel hop brown ale. Aroma is great. A bit disappointing how little it tastes. Could be better with food. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottled. Dark ruby colour, creamy lightly tan head. Intense hoppy nose; loads of resins and citrusfruits with sweet floral notes.  Some ripe plums and a hint of caramelly malts. Flavor starts medium sweet with toastedness and hints of coffee. Brutal, resiny and citrusy bitterness then strikes with lingering power, but nice coffeyish notes and nuttiness appears in the late finish. Very good beer.

At a tasting, thanks DSG, pours brown with a small head, aroma of citra, floral notes, lemon and some chocolate tones, flavor is lemony, with bread, smoked malt, chocolate and spices like mint, quite dry with medium body, nice

Pours dark brown with a large frothy lightbrown head which leaves nice lacing while it slowly settles. Lots of grapefruit, pine and some caramel in aroma. Flavor has lots of citrus, pine and roasted sugar, and it finishes nice and bitter.

Oops! Fantastic fresh and spicy aroma of hops with hints of roasted malt, coffee and chocolate. The flavor is distinctly spicy and hops aromatic. The malt does not make a fuss, but appears only in the background of the flavor. In the aftertaste there is a rich hops bitterness. A nice beer!
Dark brown body with a tan head. Coffee notes on the aroma along with pine. Citra shows through more in the taste then the roasted flavours. Very drinkable.

Bottled (from systembolaget, thanks mom & dad). Deep amber colour, small off-whit to beige creamy head that leaves good lace. Aroma is cookies, some sweet hops, mild nectar, quite bitter floral notes as well. Flavour is big time fruity and floral hops with grassy notes. Also some liquorice, Mild nutty notes.

Bottle. Aroma is lovely citra and some other fruity hops, faint touch of biscuit malt and some caramel.
Flavour is piney and resinous hop, medium bitterness. Medium (caramel) malt touch.
Nice one, I like Citra.

Bottled from Systembolaget
Wet hay in the aroma. A bit fruity.
Pretty unbalanced bitterness.
Licorice and tar.

UPDATED: NOV 25, 2011 Bottled. Pours dark amber brown with an average sized, creamy, off-white head, leaving an excellent lacing on the glass. Nose of roasted coffee, citrus, exotic fruits and notes of cats piss. Medium Sweet flavor with tropical fruits, citrus, caramel, chocolate and roasted coffee. Medium to full bodied, creamy texture and soft carbonation. The finish is more dry, nice bitter and with some roastiness too. A well brewed and very interesting beer.

Bottle. Dark, hazy, very small and fully diminishing light brown head. Moderate malty and sweetish aroma, some caramel and tropical fruitiness, light roasted malt with piney and grapefruit hoppyness. Body is medium, malty and lightly sweetish flavor, some caramel and light tropical fruitiness, light roasted malt, piney and grapefruit hoppyness. Finish is average, malty and dryish with light fruitiness, caramel and light roasted malt, lots of piney hoppyness. Really nice hoppyness for brown ale. Too much caramel though finish is quite dry.

Aroma: Pine, Grapefruit and Apricot.
Taste: Pine, grapefruit. Hint of chocolate fudge that rounds it off.
Mouthfeel: Very bitter, but the nice caramel malt balance it out and makes it easier to drink.
@ Copenhagen festival 2011. The aroma has caramel, some roast, citrus. Dark brown coloured beer with an off-white head. The taste is sweet, has caramel, some coffee, hops. Nice.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Dagans place. Brown color with an off-white head. Citric aroma with light roastiness. Flavor has some sweetness with malt and light fruitiness, and a pleasant grapefruity, hoppy bitterness. Medium-bodied. Good.
Bottle from Systembolaget, named höst citra. Pours dark brown with tan head. A: citrus, tropical fruits, coffee, roasted malts. T: very bitter what balaces nicely. Good

Köpt på Systembolaget som Höst Citra. Ordentligt mörkbrun öl med ljusbrunt skum. Doft av citrus, tropiska frukter, barr och kaffe. Ganska bra harmoni mellan den mörka ölens rostade karaktär och humlebitterheten. Dock tar bitterheten över lite mycket för min smak.

Bottled. 
Dark brown colour with rich hop-induced foam. Aroma from rubber, citrus and chocolate. Nose is reminiscent of a Cascadian Dark Ale, with cinnamon roll features. Flavour is rich, there is chocolate well in harmony with tropical fruits as well as rubber, with a distinct bitterness that lingers, with hints of coffee. Pretty rounded mouthfeel. Again I get CDA-feelings, its cinnamon roll all the way. Great beer.

Bottle from Systembolaget. Cola brown beer with tall, foamy off-white head. Very fresh hoppy aroma with some caramel malts. Taste is bitter from the hops and the malty body isnt quite enough to back it up but works well like this too.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours chestnut brown with a large beige to light brown head. Lots of roasted coffee beans and caramel on the nose. Similar comes through in the taste. Bitter roasted coffee beans, slight nut and caramel tones. Lots of bitterness which is hidden towards the finish by a slight sweetness. Solid and unique brown

Dark brown pour neat head biege colour mild to medium carbonation floral citrus aromas mild caramel nut the flavours chocolate sharp bitter grapefruit caramel nutty stone fruit resinous taste floral more sweet than bitter at the finish even with the strong ibu still a very good ale
Found this bottle in a beer shop in Ghent and took it to discover. Surprising beer with loads of aromas and flavours. Excellent ! They can make good beers in Denmark.

Bottle as Høst Citra.
Dark reddish brown with a large tan to light brown head.
Aroma; a lot of citrus, nutty, malty.
Taste: chocolate, nuts, lightly roasted, citrus, pine, resin, some licorice, a hint of burnt rubber, medium bitter.
Medium-bodied, above average carbonation.

50cl bottle, thanks to my friend Chris for bringing it back from Copenhagen.  Small beige head atop muddy cola brown body.  Aroma is moderately sweet, grapefruit, chococaramel, some rye.  Taste is moderately sweet, bittersweet chocolate, grapefruit, rye, caramel.  Medium body, some resin, light acidity.  With all the hops, and relatively high alcohol, its hard to think of this delicious concoction as a brown ale.
Bottle from copenhagen, has a nice dark pour, the flavours are nice in this one. Its good a lot of hop flavours with a solid thick body. Overall quite enjoyable

Bottle. Pours a clear dark brown with a lasting foamy tan head and plenty of lacing. Aroma is very hoppy with lots of pine needles, orange, grapefruit and other citrus hints as well as some subtle caramel notes. Flavour is also very hoppy and very similar to the aroma although the malty caramel undertone is a bit more pronounced here. Dry and light bodied with lively carbonation and a lingering bitter finish. A very nice beer, almost like a fusion of IPA and Brown Ale styles, this is really easy to drink.

"Höst Citra"-bottle from Systembolaget.
Pours brown with a creamy firm tan head.
Aroma of citrus and caramell.
Drinkable, hoppy taste and a hint of coffee.

Small to medium cream-tan head, over opaque, deep-brown beer with a ruby sheen. Melanoidins & citrus hops - strange, but nice combination; dark bread baked with preserved citrusfruit, garden herbs and dried figs; liquorice warming up. Very dry, wry-woody flavour & MF; bitter chocolate. Cakey, but rather burnt cake, supporting the hops. Strong, unsugared bitter black tea. Not really balanced. Warming up, strawberry flavour. Tad aggressive MF; but well-bodied, slick; seriously carbonated; Maybe some minor defaults, but endearing all the same. Maybe I sampled it just a tad too cold, my mistake.

En sak slår en när man dricker Kama Citra, och det nästan bokstavligt: beskan. Den är så tung och otymplig att man riskerar att knäcka smaklökarna. Men lyckas man härda sig mot den finns en hel värld av ljuvligheter att upptäcka och lapa i sig.
Bottle purchased in Copenhagen. Poured dark brown with little head that retained. Medium body with upfront bitterness and light citrus/pine hoppy finish. Very good.

Intressant och komplex smak, den ger intrycket av att vara välhumlad men maltigheten tar över fullständigt. Humlen gör istället sig påmind genom en syrlighet som tar över där maltigheten försvinner. Märklig öl med märklig smak, inte dålig bara märklig.

Bottle from Systembolaget. It poured a very dark brown liquid with a big and long lasting light brown head. Frutity smell of hops when the Citra breaks through the dark musty malts. The hops isnt as strong in the taste but still there in the background, malt dominates. Very thick and fat body with a semi-smooth mouthfeel and medium-low amount of carbonation. Very nice, works well now that the days grow shorter and nights grown longer.

Bottle from SB Majorna cons 2011-09-17 Göteborg
Ar: roasted malt, citrus, apricot, pine, butter
Ap: dark ruby, high frothy dark beige head - lovely lacings
F: grape fruite, apricot jam, roasted malt, caramel, licorice, bitter finish

Bottle. 
Clear dark brownish red with a big porous tanned head that lace nicely.
Big hoppy pine aroma with fresh squeezed pine needles. Some nutty toffee with orange peel and play-doh jumps in the back ground.
Sweet nutty taste with a robust herby bitterness with orange peel and grapefruit. Caramel, chocolate, dark bread with herbs and some licorice. When it warms up it gets more fruity with peach. 
Quite full-bodied with lively but nice carbonation.
Great beer!

(Bottle) Pours dark mahogany brown with a creamy, nougat coloured head. The aroma holds grapefruit, pine soap and resin up front with undertones of lime, cookies, wet crisp bread, dark bread, light roast( milk chocolate and mild coffee), light pear, apples and maybe some kiwi. Boatloads of hops alongside a well-adjusted malt profile. The flavour is light sweet, medium to heavily bitter and light acidic on the finish. Tones of citrus, resin, dark bready malt and mild roast. The mouthfeel is round and soft with light carbonation. Aggressive resinous/grapefruity finish. Medium bodied.

Pours a redbrown color with a mediumsized, creamy beige-white head. Aroma of pine needles, grapefruit, citrus, nuts and caramel. Flavour of grapefruit, resin, pine needles, citrus, nuts and a malty toffee background. Mediumbodied with average carbonation.

Bottle(at the Label: Høst Citra) Clear red colour, with a nice creamy head. Aroma is dominated of bomb of hops(fruits and flowers, some citrus too) 
Flavor had a nice creamy mouthfeeling of fruits, citrus, dry fruits and some raisins. Thin to medium body and a nice long fruity finish. Werry nice Brown Ale.
this was a real treat, thanks to Scott and Andrew for bring this one back. caramel malt flavour balance very nicely with earthy and citrus hops. great beer!

Bottle (35 cl) from Systembolaget. Deep brownish red, medium beige head. Roasted and almost smokey aromas with strong citric and piney hops. Meidum bodied and smooth. Dry with a massive but pleasant  bitterness.

Bottle 500ml (as Höst Citra). A clear dark red-brown colour with an average high, beige head. An aroma of malt, coffee, and citrus (orange and grapefruit). Some toasted notes. The taste is medium sweet and bitter. A medium body, oily texture, soft carbonation and a long finish.

Bottle. (labelled as Beer Here Høst Citra)

Clear dark reddish/brown with a medium tan head. Hoppy aroma with citrus and some notes of earth. Hoppy  and bitter taste with coffee, roasted malt and caramel. A good beer.

500ml Bottle (as Höst Citra) - Dark brown with a foamy head. Chocolate, hops, dried fruit and a hint of liquorice in the aroma. Chocolatey, hoppy and slightly soapy taste with notes of nuts, dried fruit, grapefruit and liquorice.

Bottle, 50cl - Dark red beer with a beige head. Aroma is fruity with notes of passion fruits, grapefruit, rye bread and apricot. Flavor malty with notes of melon, grapefruit, spices, anis and citrus. Very nice and though being slightly too bitter it still remains balanced.
A perfectly fine brown ale even though it isnt one of my favourites. Has the typicla characteristics of burned brown sugar etc
Bottle. Labeled as Höst Citra. Brown colour with a beige head. Hops, citrus (oranges & grapefruit), rye bread, caramel, licorice, wood, tannins, too bitter finish for my liking.

500ml bottle, as "Höst Citra".
Pours an almost clear, medium brown.
Lots of hops and caramel in the aroma, citrus, chocolate, fudge, malt, goosberry, cats pee, grass, ripe melons,.
Off-dry, medium body, medium to high bitterness, balanced CO2, quite creamy.
The taste is mostly roasted malts, caramel and citrusy hops, some ashes/smoke, fudge, chocolate, rather fruity, nuts, apricots.
Quite interesting take on the traditional brown ale theme, finishes a bit dry and yeasty, lika a very good home brew. (2011-09-10)

Bottle from Systembolaget. Dark rownish red in color, a small short-lasting off-beige head. Very hoppy aroma with ctrus and pine, some resin as well. Thin to medium body with a fizzy carbonation, a lomg bitterness finishes off.

Bottle bought @ Systembolaget and consumed on September 10. Labeled as Høst Citra. Pours dark brown with a rather thin fizzy head that stays for longer than expected. Smell is fresh and filled with citrus fruits like grapefruit, lemon and lime. Smells a lot like a well hopped IPA. Taste is bitter and refreshing. The citrus is dominant here too but there is also malty sweetness and some ash. The taste is also very IPA like which I guess makes this more of a black (brown) IPA than a brown ale. Very nice and refreshing!

50cl bottle (labelled as Host Citra), bought @ Systembolaget Avenyn, Göteborg. Last day of visit, shared with Gnoff.
Couleur acajou, col épais et soyeux beige.
Arôme houblonné de citra, agréable de pin ayant plus le profile dune Black IPA avec un nez de malt grillé qui accompagne le tout.
Bière faisant bon usage du malt, grillé, avec lajout du citra qui donne un profile fruité et tropical passant du citron, à la mangue, fruits passion, etc.
Malt reste bien présent et donne un palais complet de chocolat et grillé.

50 cl bottle as Beer Here Høst CitraThanks to sebletitje!Purchased from Systembolaget Avenyn, Göteborg. Sampled on September 5, 2011BB 29.06.12Clear dark brown to red color, tan head. Citrus, lemon, hoppy scent. Malty, sweet, hoppy, alcohol taste. Smooth mouthfeel, high bitterness.Tasty.

Ölet heter egentligen Kama Citra och har en ganska mörk färg med en fin skumkrona. 

D: Doften är ganska jordig med en tydlig citruston. 
S: Tydlig humle, men även stora brända toner, karamell och kaffe.

E: Eftersmaken har också en distinkt bränd karaktär, och det gör den tyvärr lite obalanserad

Bottle. I wouldnt have guessed this being a brown ale. Its really all about citrus hops. Lots of blood orange and grapefruit notes. Quite bitter. Sure, there are some more brown ale-like chocolate notes in the background. But there in the bakcground really. This one tastes more lika a Black IPA or something like that.

Bottle bought @Kihoskh, København, enjoyed at home. Pours a clear, beautiful brownish-ruby body, with a moderate cream-ish light choco top. Aroma is a nice-smelling blend of bready and caramel-scented malts vs citrus- and tropical fruity hops. Taste has a bold and clean bitterness, not giving much room for hop flavor. Lightly roasted, dark bready and choclatey malts in the background. Well-bodied. Creamy texture. Strong bitter ending. Smells great, taste is a tad too bitter to be fully balanced.  Not your everyday Brown Ale. Overall, an exciting and tasty beer experience.

500 ml bottle from Systembolaget.Clear, brown liquid with medium to big tan head. Aroma is quite fruity, hoppy and a bit roasted with notes of grapefruit, tropical fruit, soapy hops, roasted malt, coffee, citrus and mango. Good balance. Taste is hoppy and a bit chocolatey and roasted with heavy bitterness (for the style) and light sweetness. Medium bodied with OK carbonation and lingering, bitter finish. Maybe a bit too high bitterness for the style. Some alcohol is noticed as well, but it isnt that disturbing. The balance is a bit off because of the bitterness. Still good though, the freshness of the Citra hops helps freshen up a quite robust brown ale.
Bottled.  Clear brown, smal lfirm head. Aroma of coffee and pear-like hops. Medium bodied with clean, rounded mouthfeel. Lots of pears and resin. Inky mega-bitter finish. Seriously over hopped.

Bottle, 50 cl: Very brown, nearly opaque, beer with a frothy beige head. Roasty and fruity aroma with loads of caramel, grapefruits and tropical fruits. Taste is medium sweet and heavy bitter with lots of fruity notes: Tangerine, pinapple, mango and grapefruit. Medium body, thick oily texture, average carbonation and a long, dry and bitter hoppy finish. Brown ales can be a drag - but this one is beautiful and fresh!

Blumig hopfiger Antrunk, frisch, voll. Auch später bleibt das Bier hopfig-würzig, die Aromen sind abwechslungsreich, verschiedene Früchte buhlen im Hopfen um die Oberhand. Daneben ist auch das Malz erwähnenswert, dass ein wichtiges Grundaroma ergibt und zuweilen röstig ist. Ausgewogen hopfig, Zitrus, blumig, zum Ende auch erdig, adstringend bitter. Gut! 11/11/12/12/12/12

Clear dark reddish brown with a lasting beige head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, a little nutty and rather hoppy - peach and grapefruit. Flavor is quite sweet and very bitter. Dry and rather bitter finish. 230711
Draft at Makke.  Interesting combination of chocolate and bitterness, a fairly decent addition to the style.
Pours brown with a beige head. Aroma is roasted bread, citrus and fruity notes. Flavour is roasted caramel, citrus, light peach, nutes and fruity notes.

500 ml bottle. BBE 08.02.2013.
Pours a dark brown colour with a foamy white head. Aroma of dark chocolate and Citra hops, quite interesting actually. Flavour of smooth caramel malts, dark chocolate, bread and Citra hops. Exceptionally smooth mouthfeel with a lovely chocolate-like, crispy bitter finish. Im not a big fan of Citra but this was really good.

500ml bottle from Bierkompass, shared
BBE 08.02.2013 - Pours dark reddish brown with a medium foamy head. Aroma has notes of chocolate, coffee and citrus from citra hops. Taste is very chocolatey with notes of coffee and nice citrusy fruitness from citra hops. Bitter, long lasting caramely finish. Nice surprise, didnt expect this one to taste this good.

Bottle 50 cl, Skjold Burne, Århus. Pours deep ruby mahogany with a huge creamy tanned head leaving lots of lace. Aroma is slightly roasted, caramel, citric, cat bin, coffee and fruity. Flavor is much like the aroma, nicely acidy and with an excellent bitterness. Finishes fruity and very malty, some chocolate and longlived bitter aftertaste. Well balance I think, damn good to drink.

Pours a clear and brown beer with a beige head. The aroma is malt, caramel and hops with flowers and citrus. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is bitterness. Overall a really good beer with a good balance.

Bottle at my East Croydon tasting, thanks to Leighton. It pours (surprisingly to me) darkest brown/near black with ruby highlights, with a thin foamy beige head and moderate carbonation. The nose is caramel, resin, cat piss, wood, citrus and light spice. The taste is lemon, lime, orange pith, caramel, liquorice, treacle, burnt sugar, roasted malt, grass and wood, with a long bitter finish. Tastes more like a black IPA than a brown ale, but a tasty brew nonetheless.

Bottle at the East Croydon Beer Tasting. Pours dark brown with a huge, beige head. Lots of citrus and pine on the nose, subtle coffee roast. Delicious flavor, sweet and roasty malts, some light espresso, resinous and grapefruity bitterness. Medium in body with average carbonation. Pretty bitter on the finish, blend of dry roast and scorched earth, some pine and fresh grass, mild mocha. Great beer.
Bottle, KØ11. Mild citric aroma. Clear very dark brown colour. Very small head. The flavour is nicely hoppy, has some grassy notes. Like a DIPA, but probably with less alcohol.

Bottle. Its a clear-looking copper to brown beer with a dense, beige head. Pine-cones, citrus peel, roasted malts and caramel on the nose. Roasted malts, pine cones and some caramel in the flavor, bitter and roasted towards the finish. Full body. Certainly with some similarities with a black IPA, but not exactly there. A nice beer it is anyway. Rating: 7-4-7-4-15-3.7. 110300Bottle. A quite clear, brown body is topped by a dense, off-white to beige head. The aroma is citrusy and piney, with roasted malts and caramel in the back. Its quite bitter in the mouth, full-bodied, and with citrusy, piney hops on a bed of roasted malts and caramel. Lasting bitter finish. A nice and tasteful beer. 110330

Bottle 50 cl tasted @ Karhisma Birroteca (Piedimonte Matese, Caserta - Italy). Pours brown with amber, ruby, rusty and red texture. Not so big beige foam, but creamy and long-lasting; even if you sip, it remains and pervade your lips. Nice structured aroma of vanilla, coffee grounds, hay, a little bit of spices, hops; its wholeness gives sense of balance. Creamy body, light to medium, low carbonated but fizzy; like a Lindt chocolate tablet with orange added, but bitter and salty as well. Caramel and coffee again, leads to an intense floral, citric, grassy and bitter finish of hops. After two or three seconds it turns to something REALLY astringent, harsh and quite spicy or peppery that lasts long, long and *long* at palate as a squeeze of grapefruit juice. This is a very good brown ale, it has the smoothness and simplicity of a classic one despite the intensity of an imperial one. I like it, compliments to Skovdal Andersen.

Bottle. Fine nut-caramel- citrus aroma. Brown hazy. Low carbonation small head with medium body. Sweet grapefruit flavours. Faint bitter finish. A
well balance brown ale. Prefer more carbonation and less sweetness.

50 cl bottle, BBE 08.02.13
An aroma that can be observed from a distance of one meter from the pour. Sweet and exotic fruits, very pleasant. Also some nuts typical to brown ale. Taste has some dark nuts and overaged, exotic fruits. Quite ok brown ale, but I dont think that citra fits so well with this kind of brew. The hops became even more annoying towards the end of the glass. But a nice label anyway.

from Erzbierschof.ch - cloudy dark brown colour with a poor head retention; piney aroma with notes of coffee and gingerbread; quite full-bodied, very tasty and with some harsh bitterness; malty and coffeish aftertaste with a solid aromatic hop presence
UPDATED: SEP 5, 2011 50cl, new Danish brew Anno 2011, from De Hopduvel Gent, complex bitter brew, fruity and slightly roasted, balanced, clear, small head, good brew, yet expensive
(Bottle 9/6-2011) Fruity hoppy aroma, dark brown, rather slim malt body compared to the bitter finish.

Bottle sample @ Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Deep copper brown body, small beige head. Aroma is strawberry, deep malts and hints of caramel. Taste is roasty dark malts, grassy hops, hints of peaches and strawberry. Bitter finish. OK, but not great and more like a roasty IPA than a brown ale.

Sampler at CBF 2011-05-26. Clear nut brown with a creamy, light brown head. Cat piss and roasted aromas. Roasted and hoppy bitter with coffee present. Alcohol. Long, dry and roasted finish. Full body. Very nice.
Tasted at Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011. Dark brown colour with a beige head. Aroma and flavour of fruit, hops, chocolate, caramel and roasted malt.

Sampled @ Copenhagen Beer Festival 2011 from a 0.5l bottle. Pours a really deep brown body with a low islandy beige head. Has an lovely fruity hopy aroma with pineapple, peach and apricot hints. Really fruity and nice, almost so fruity that I have my doubt that this is a brown ale. Oily mouthfeeling, its average carbonated and medium-bodied. Flavors are also quite fruit-hopy with nice notes of chocolate, roasted malts,a light ashy finish and a really nice longlasting roasted aftertaste. A really good beer, but as one wise man said: "This tastes like a brown india pale ale(BRIPA), and not like a brown ale "
Bottle. Dark brown colour wit an off-white head. Aroma is citrus, hop, pine, grapefruit, caramel. Flavour is citrus, hop, pine, grapefruit, caramel, roasted malt. Nice beer.

At Copenhagen Beer Festival. Brown colour. Lovely aroma and flavour of brown and lightly roasted malts, caramel, rye bread and a little chocolate, mixed with distinct fruity (apricot, melon, citrus) hops. I was sceptical how well Citra hops would fit in a brown ale, but Beer Here have succeeded. Good stuff!

UPDATED: MAR 18, 2016 (on tap @ Taphouse) Poured in a large shaker glass at fridge temperature reveals a cloudy dark amber beer with one finger tan head. Good retention and beautiful lace. Aroma has notes of toasted malt, caramel malt and citrus fruits. Oily texture with soft carbonation, full body and finish that embodies a certain amont of malty sweetness along with a drying sensation from hop bitterness. Its still good but I find myself more partial to the amber ale style these days.

Original ratings from May 28th and July 28th 2011:
A: 9; ap: 5; Fl: 9; Pa: 5; O: 18
(10 cl on tap, CBF 2011 as well as 50 cl bottle from Toft Vin) Pours a reddish brown with medium, toffee head that laces the glass. Aroma is unusually (for the style) fruity citra hop style with notes of caramel malt. Almost creamy texture on the palate with medium carbonation. Full bodied with a long, dry finish. Taste is bitter, toasted and rich with a herbal hop character. Refreshingly unconventional - extra points for well implemented originality.

Bottle @ Vinens Verden, Odense. Pours unclear ruby brown with a small white head and lacings. Waaauw - freshly hopped nose. Pine needles, grapefruit, caramel and coffeee. Dry and lasting bitterness. Smooth. Dopeness.

bottle at home.
clear brown, huge smooth light brown head.
Strong aroma of citra hops (glass is 30cm away and i can rate the aroma remotely) Aroma is bitterhoppy, citrussy, faint sweet malty. Very nice.
flavor is malty, dry from hops, slighlty grapefruity, palate is smooth. Flavor and aroma is so hoppy that if I had blind tasted this one i would likely have guessed on black ipa, double ipa or american strong ale. Way more hoppy than anything else ive had that claimed to be a brown ale. Be warned.  If anythnig it might taste like a blend between a brown ale and an IPA: Tasty, quenching, a little sweet (for an ipa) but superdry and hoppy (for a brown ale). Another unique brew from CSA.
Bottle from Skjold Burne. Nice head with good duration. Color is brown. Aroma and taste are rich hops, nuts, fruits, flowers, caramel and malt. Nice bitter finish.

Draft @ Ølbaren, Copenhagen. Pours a dark amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy aroma. Slightly roasted malty hoppy citrus flavor with hints of licorice. Has a roasted malty hoppy bitter citrus finish.

Bottled. Dark amber coloured. Dense beige head. Aroma of caramel, spice, dark fruits, herbs and some grape. Flavour of caramel, dark fruits, spice, herbs, some flowers and grape. Medium to full bodied. Dense grapy bitterness in the end.

23-APR-2011, bottle @home, from "Fish & Beer".
Mahogany with grey head.
I close my eyes and it is an IPA.
Extremely bitter, earthy, citric notes, almost petrol, grape fruit.
A hard to find malty background is there, the hops just dominate.
Extreme brown ale:-)

23/04/2011 Domus Birrae (tap). Nera scura, con schiuma color marroncino. Ricorda più una stout che una brown ale. Sensazione confermata al naso, dove spicca un forte aroma caffettoso, e il luppolo citra, aspro e secco. In bocca è equilibratissima, con un amaro netto erbaceo e caffettoso e un delizioso retrogusto dolciastro. Corpo medio, carbonazione generosa. Una eccellente brown ale.

Its dark mahogany-red with a creamy, golden head. The aroma has notes of fruity hops, citrus, roasted malt, coffee and coffee grinds. The flavour has a light sweetness and a nice bitterness, and it has notes of roasted malt, coffee, chocolate, grapefruit and other citrus, and the finish is dry and bitter.

Lovely aroma of ripe oranges. Glowing dark borwn, small head.
Creamy and sharp at the same time, deep malty brown beer with a citrus edge cutting through. Taking a mundane beer style and shaking it around.
Bottle. Brown/orange with small tan head. Flavour is malt, caramel, hops, bitter, pine, chocolate, little nuts and sweet,

Mahognyfärgad med beige skum. Stor doft, lite engelska vibbar, rågbröd, fruktig humle typ melon. Blöt mjuk munkänsla, som en väldigt välhumlad mörk ESB men med lite fruktigare humleprofil. Fin lång beska.

UPDATED: APR 5, 2011 Deep ruby brown with a small off-white head. Intensely hoppy aroma with pine and grapefruit and grass most dominant with underlying caramel and biscuit. Sweet caramel, biscuit and chocolate malty flavour followed by extreme bitterness and long lasting hop flavour. The flavour has more of the lime and exotic fruits youd expect from the citra, while the aroma actually reminded me more of Christian SAs Ølfabrikken India Brown Ale than any citra beer.

Bottle, bought @ Havnens Vin & Tobak, Vejle.
Lovely deep, clear, chestnut brown with a lovely, staying, creamy, off-white head. Wonderful looks for the style. Pleasant hoppy aroma with some dark caramel, hazelnuts and Belgian sugar thrown in. Hops are citric (doh!), some plant sap, resiny, light piney. Medium carbonation, dry and fine creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has plenty of hops, citric and resiny, light apricot and peach. Fine sweet middle with light chocolate and sweet malts before turning seriously bitter and dry at the end with an almost herbal finish in my mouth. Very lovely for us hop-heads, but perhaps not the most balanced Beer Here ever.

Hazy brown with a small baige head. Powerfull complex aroma of primary grapefruit  along with melon, dark bread, rye and raw chocolate. Very high bitterness in the flavor, mainly from the hops but with some roasted malt notes. Backed up by a medium caramel sweetness and some nice warming alchohol. Overall a great beer.

Bottle 500ml at Beer2000 courtesy of Meilby. Pours clear brown with small offwhite head. Aroma is pine, citrus, caramel, bit of roastiness. Taste is light sweet, medium bitter. Medium body, thin to oily, soft carbonation. Extremely hoppy, a bit unbalanced.

Bottle 500ml @ Beer2000
Pours dark brown with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of citrus, malt, caramel and a little coffee. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle courtesy of Meilby.Pours brown with an off-white head.Aroma of cheesy , citrus and cat-pea hops with some malty and roasted notes.Flavor is bitter and sweet with some fruity and citrus hop notes.Medium body, average carbonation.Overwhelmingly hoppy beer.

Draught @ Lord Nelson, Hyskenstraede 9, 1207 Copenhagen, Denmark.Clear medium to dark brown color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white to beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, roasted, coffee, light heavy hoppy, orange - citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruit, citrus. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is medium, texture is oily and smooth, carbonation is soft. [20110211]

Bottle. hazy red brown color, almost no head. Aroma is reminiscent of a pale ale with a bunch of very fresh hops. Citrus and lots of lime. Very nicely balanced and with a complex hop/malt character. Taste is extremely fresh, lots of hops and a malt profile that hits the spot. Fresh citrus, lime, caramel, very dry, fresh carbonation. Also some grape. One of the best brown ales ive tried.

Bottle at bager.
Clear red brown coloured with a medium sized beige head.
Fruity aroma of hops, caramel, grass and pine needles.
Fruity flavour of hops, grass and pine needles.
Dry hoppy finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy brown with a creamy light beige head. The aroma is very exotic fruity hoppy with notes of citrus, melon and grape fruit. Good malty backbone. The flavour is citrus, grapefruit, light peach and melon. Sweet malty notes as well as light chocolate. Very tasty.

Flaske: Brun øl med et fint skumhoved. Duften er velhumlet og minder en del om det hedengangne Ølfabrikken India brown ale. Dejlig øl, men med lidt for meget citrus til at den kommer helt op og ringe. Det clasher meget lidt med den søde malt der ellers gør det til en umiskendelig brown ale. God.
De barril. Hoppy well toasted malty citrus fresh aroma. Good mouthfeel. Lots of fresh citrus hops and bitterness with toasted malt in the flavour, dry. Hoppy brown indeed.

Bottle 50 cl. Nice large creamy off-white head that mostly lasted. Somewhat cloudy brown color. Fair display of lacework. Aroma of pineapple, grape, hint of peach and some mixed floral notes. Over the palate came caramel and light nutty notes with some light toasted malty feel as well. Medium bodied with an average carbonation and dry texture. Moderated bitter flavor with good counter sweetness making this beer quite balanced and very drinkable. Moderately dry and light bitter finish.

Bottle. Dark brown with pale brown head. Aroma intense very hoppy, grape and pine. Taste very bitter and hoppy, lots of bitterness in the finish. Hard to find the brown ale in this one, it reminds me most of all of an IPA. Rated to style it wouldn´t do well, as it´s too much reminding of an IPA, but fine as an IPA.

Cockney Pub, AArhus, DK.
Tap, 11022011.
Brown with small beige head. Aroma of citrus and malt. Flavor with much grapefruit

On tap. Beautiful, clear reddish brown with an off-white head. Fresh tropical fruit in the nose. Rather light body, light nutty accents and a little caramel but completely dominated by the tropical hops leaving a massive bitterness. Fresh! 100211

From tap at Lord Nelson. Pours hazy dark brown with a small off-white head. Rather fruity and dark caramelish malty. Nice hoppy and citrusy, grapefruity and slight peachy. Lingering grapefruity and dry citrusy finish.

Bottle. Pours a dark ruby red/brown color with a frothy beige head. Aroma is super hoppy with loads of grapefruit and notes of topical fruits. You also get some faint caramelly notes, but the aroma is mostly hoppy. Flavor is again a hop monster with tons of grapefruit, some tropical fruit and peach. In the back end you get some faint toasted and caramelly malts. The body is medium with a powdery-dry mouthfeel. Overall a really good Indian Brown Ale, that would become more Brown Ale-like after some time, when the hops has settled down. But I prefer it this way.

Draft. A deep red beer with a thin beige.  The aroma has strong notes of lemon, grapefruit, and cats piss. The flavor is sweet with notes grapefruit, lemon peal, and green apples, leading to an extremely bitter finish.
Draught at Lord Nelson. Clear dark brown - white head. Roasted. Berries. Nutty. Bitterness. Light burned. Chocolate. Fruity. Peppery. Gunpowder. High hoppy. Nice bitter finish.

Tap at IB René, Cario in Ålborg. Hazy dark brown with a small white head. Aroma is fruity abd citrusslike hops on top of sweet caramel malt.
Taste is strong hops, lemon and other citruss, kiwi and caramel, nuts, roasted malt.  Medium body, medium carbonation. 280111

UPDATED: JUN 16, 2014 Aroma of hops, citrus, resin and some dark nuances. Taste add some more tropical nuances and some more roastyness and sweets from the malts. Bitterness from the hops follows with citrus and there is also caramel in there. I like this interpretation of a brown ale!

Pours murky brown with a small brown head. Aroma is packed with fresh citra hops, crispy caramel and nutty malts, citrus, kiwi, very fruity on top of the dark malts. The taste is at first insanely hoppy with the frsh citra hops that packs citrus, kiwi,  pine and grape. The malts are evident and on the sweet side, but are held in place by the up front hops. This hoppy brownn ale thing can easily go wrong, but this beer really takes it to the max. Really good.
